title: How to Make Popcorn Snacks for Kids

steps.headline: Grease a bowl, spatula, and baking dish.
steps.description: Because the caramel is extremely sticky, you must prepare your tools and supplies. Use nonstick cooking spray to grease a large bowl, plastic spatula, and a 13-inch by 9-inch (33-cm by 23-cm) baking dish before mixing the popcorn. If you prefer, you can use softened butter to grease your tools and supplies.

steps.headline: Mix the popcorn and pretzel pieces.
steps.description: Add 10 cups (80 g) of popped popcorn that’s lightly salted and 40 small pretzel twists that have been broken into pieces to the large, greased bowl. Toss the ingredients lightly to ensure that they’re completely mixed. You can air pop your own popcorn or use microwave popcorn. Just make sure to choose an unbuttered version. Any type of unflavored pretzels will work for the popcorn bowls. For example, you might use plain, whole wheat, or honey wheat pretzels depending on your preference.

steps.headline: Melt the butter on the stove.
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons (28 g) of unsalted butter to a medium size saucepan. Heat the butter on medium on your stovetop until it melts completely, which should take 2 to 3 minutes. Stir the butter to help it melt evenly.

steps.headline: Stir in the caramels, water, salt, and heat until the caramels melt.
steps.description: Once the butter has melted completely, add 20 caramels, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of water, and ⅛ teaspoon (1 g) of salt to the saucepan. Allow the mixture to heat for approximately 5 minutes, or until the caramels have melted completely. Stir the caramel mixture occasionally as it’s melting to ensure that it heats evenly. Use the greased spatula to keep the caramel from sticking to it.

steps.headline: Add the marshmallows and peanut butter, and heat until they melt.
steps.description: When the caramels have melted completely, mix 3 cups (150 g) of miniature marshmallows and ¼ cup (65 g) of crunchy peanut butter into the pan. Allow the mixture to heat for another 1 to 2 minutes or until the marshmallows and peanut also melt. Be sure to stir the mixture as the peanut butter and marshmallows melt to ensure that all of the ingredients are fully blended.

steps.headline: Pour the caramel mixture over the popcorn and pretzels and toss to coat.
steps.description: When the caramel mixture is fully melted and blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn and pretzels. Use the greased spatula to toss the mixture well so the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture. The caramel mixture may be hot, so be careful not to get any on your skin.

steps.headline: Press the popcorn mixture into the baking dish and cool completely.
steps.description: Once the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture, use the spatula to transfer it to the greased baking dish. Press the coated popcorn down, and allow it to cool completely, which should take 30 minutes to 1 hour. Make sure that the popcorn is in a single, even layer so it’s easier to cut the mixture into bars.

steps.headline: Cut the popcorn mixture into bars.
steps.description: When the coated popcorn has cooled and set, use a sharp knife to cut it into bars. You should wind up with approximately 24. Store any leftover popcorn bars in an airtight container at room temperature. They should stay fresh for 3 to 5 days.

steps.headline: Place the popcorn in a large bowl.
steps.description: For the poppy chow, you’ll need 8 cups (64 g) of plain, popped popcorn. Pour it into a large bowl, making sure to pick out any unpopped or burnt kernels. You can prepare the popcorn yourself or use a bag of microwave popcorn as long as it’s not buttered.

steps.headline: Add the powdered sugar to a plastic bag.
steps.description: To make it easier to coat the popcorn, place 1 ½ cups (188 g) of powdered sugar into a large plastic bag with a zipper. Set the bag aside until you’re ready to add the popcorn. Use a gallon (3.7 l) plastic bag or larger to be sure that there’s enough room to add the popcorn later.

steps.headline: Melt the peanut butter and chocolate chips in the microwave.
steps.description: Add 1 cup (250 g) of peanut butter and ½ cup (90 g) of chocolate chips to medium size microwave-safe bowl. Heat the mixture in the microwave in 30 second intervals until it is melted completely. It typically takes between 1 to 2 minutes. Smooth peanut butter works best for the poppy chow. You can use whatever type of chocolate chips that you prefer, such as milk, semisweet, or bittersweet. Make sure to stir the peanut butter and chocolate chips after each 30 second interval so the mixture melts evenly.

steps.headline: Mix the vanilla extract into the peanut butter mixture.
steps.description: When the peanut butter and chocolate are completely melted, add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) of vanilla extract to the bowl. Stir well to ensure that it’s fully combined. Adding the vanilla is an optional step. You can omit it if you prefer.

steps.headline: Pour the peanut butter mixture over the popcorn.
steps.description: When the peanut butter and chocolate mixture is fully blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn. Stir the mixture with a spatula or wooden spoon to ensure that the popcorn is fully coated.

steps.headline: Transfer the popcorn to the bag with the powdered sugar and toss to coat.
steps.description: After the popcorn is covered with the chocolate mixture, add it to the bag with powdered sugar. Seal the bag, and shake the popcorn well to coat it with the sugar. Pour it into a bowl and serve immediately. Store any leftover poppy chow in an airtight container. It should keep for up to 2 days.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and line a baking sheet.
steps.description: Set your oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit (95 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. Next, line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray the paper generously with nonstick cooking spray to grease it. For best results, place your oven rack in the lowest position.

steps.headline: Spread the tomato paste on the parchment paper.
steps.description: Open a 6-ounce (170 g) can of tomato paste. Use a small offset spatula or butter knife to spread the paste in a thin layer over the parchment paper on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Bake the tomato paste until it darkens.
steps.description: Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven. Let the paste bake until it becomes a deep brick red color and no longer looks shiny, which should take approximately 2 hours. The paste will resemble fruit leather when it’s finished baking.

steps.headline: Allow the paste to cool and tear it into pieces.
steps.description: Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and allow it to cool until you can handle it comfortably, which should take approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Use clean hands to tear the paste into pieces. You don’t have to worry about ripping the paste into even or neat pieces. Just tear it into pieces that will fit easily in your spice grinder.

steps.headline: Grind the paste with the parmesan, oregano, salt, and pepper flakes.
steps.description: Transfer the tomato paste pieces to your spice grinder and grind them down into coarse powder. Next, add 2 tablespoons (10 g) of grated parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, 1 teaspoon (3 g) garlic salt, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of crushed red pepper flakes to the spice grinder. Grind the mixture until it becomes a fine powder. Store the pizza-flavored powder in an airtight container. It should keep for up to a week. You’ll have enough powder for approximately 6 batches of popcorn.

steps.headline: Toss the popcorn with the spice.
steps.description: When you’re ready to make the pizza popcorn, add 3 cups (24 g) of popped popcorn that you’ve drizzled melted butter over to a large bowl. Sprinkle 2 heaping tablespoons (14 to 16 g) of the pizza-flavored powder over it, and toss the popcorn to coat. If you don’t want to add butter to your popcorn, spritz it lightly with olive oil so the pizza-flavored powder will stick.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and grease the baking pans.
steps.description: Set your oven temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. Next, grease two 15-inch by 10-inch (38-cm by 25-cm) shallow baking dishes with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. You can grease the baking dishes with softened butter if you prefer.

steps.headline: Combine the popcorn, peanuts, and dried fruit.
steps.description: Add 8 cups (64 g) of popped popcorn, 1 cup (125 g) of salted peanuts, and 7 ounces (198 g) of mixed dried fruit bits to a large bowl. Toss the ingredients to ensure that they’re fully mixed. Make sure to pick out any unpopped or burnt kernels from the popcorn. You can substitute your favorite nuts, such as walnuts or cashews, for the peanuts. You can usually find dried fruit bits with the raisins and dried cranberries at the grocery store.

steps.headline: Mix the honey, water, and lemon juice in a pan and bring to a boil.
steps.description: Add 1 cup (340 g) of honey, ¼ cup (59 ml) of water, and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice to a medium size saucepan with a heavy bottom. Heat the mixture on medium high to bring it to a boil, which should take approximately 5 to 7 minutes. Keep an eye on the honey mixture to ensure that it doesn’t boil over.

steps.headline: Boil the honey mixture for a couple of minutes.
steps.description: Once the honey mixture comes to a boil, allow it to boil for another 2 minutes. Stir the mixture constantly to ensure that it doesn’t burn onto the bottom of the pan.

steps.headline: Pour the honey mixture over the popcorn and toss to coat.
steps.description: While the honey mixture is still hot, add it to the bowl with the popcorn, peanuts, and dried fruit. Use a wooden spoon or spatula to  toss the ingredients so they’re evenly coated with the honey mixture. Be careful when tossing the popcorn because the honey mixture will be extremely hot and may burn if it gets on your skin.

steps.headline: Divide the popcorn between the baking dishes and bake in the oven.
steps.description: Once the popcorn is coated, add an even amount to each prepared baking dish. Place them in the preheated oven, and allow them to bake for 15 minutes. Stir the popcorn every 5 minutes while it’s baking to ensure that it’s not sticking to the dishes.

steps.headline: Stir the popcorn and allow it to cool.
steps.description: Remove the baking dishes from the oven, and stir the popcorn immediately. Next, allow it to cool completely, which should take approximately 20 to 30 minutes, before eating. Store the popcorn in an airtight container. It should stay fresh for up to a week.

text: Preparing Salted Popcorn Caramel Bars Grease a bowl, spatula, and baking dish. Because the caramel is extremely sticky, you must prepare your tools and supplies. Use nonstick cooking spray to grease a large bowl, plastic spatula, and a 13-inch by 9-inch (33-cm by 23-cm) baking dish before mixing the popcorn. Any type of unflavored pretzels will work for the popcorn bowls. For example, you might use plain, whole wheat, or honey wheat pretzels depending on your preference. Melt the butter on the stove. Add 2 tablespoons (28 g) of unsalted butter to a medium size saucepan. Heat the butter on medium on your stovetop until it melts completely, which should take 2 to 3 minutes. Stir the butter to help it melt evenly. Stir in the caramels, water, salt, and heat until the caramels melt. Once the butter has melted completely, add 20 caramels, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of water, and ⅛ teaspoon (1 g) of salt to the saucepan. Allow the mixture to heat for approximately 5 minutes, or until the caramels have melted completely. Stir the caramel mixture occasionally as it’s melting to ensure that it heats evenly. Use the greased spatula to keep the caramel from sticking to it. Add the marshmallows and peanut butter, and heat until they melt. When the caramels have melted completely, mix 3 cups (150 g) of miniature marshmallows and ¼ cup (65 g) of crunchy peanut butter into the pan. Allow the mixture to heat for another 1 to 2 minutes or until the marshmallows and peanut also melt. Be sure to stir the mixture as the peanut butter and marshmallows melt to ensure that all of the ingredients are fully blended. Pour the caramel mixture over the popcorn and pretzels and toss to coat. When the caramel mixture is fully melted and blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn and pretzels. Use the greased spatula to toss the mixture well so the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture. The caramel mixture may be hot, so be careful not to get any on your skin. Press the popcorn mixture into the baking dish and cool completely. Once the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture, use the spatula to transfer it to the greased baking dish. Press the coated popcorn down, and allow it to cool completely, which should take 30 minutes to 1 hour. Make sure that the popcorn is in a single, even layer so it’s easier to cut the mixture into bars. Cut the popcorn mixture into bars. When the coated popcorn has cooled and set, use a sharp knife to cut it into bars. You should wind up with approximately 24. Store any leftover popcorn bars in an airtight container at room temperature. They should stay fresh for 3 to 5 days. Mixing Up Poppy Chow Place the popcorn in a large bowl. To make it easier to coat the popcorn, place 1 ½ cups (188 g) of powdered sugar into a large plastic bag with a zipper. Set the bag aside until you’re ready to add the popcorn. Use a gallon (3.7 l) plastic bag or larger to be sure that there’s enough room to add the popcorn later. Melt the peanut butter and chocolate chips in the microwave. It typically takes between 1 to 2 minutes. Smooth peanut butter works best for the poppy chow. You can use whatever type of chocolate chips that you prefer, such as milk, semisweet, or bittersweet. Make sure to stir the peanut butter and chocolate chips after each 30 second interval so the mixture melts evenly. Mix the vanilla extract into the peanut butter mixture. When the peanut butter and chocolate are completely melted, add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) of vanilla extract to the bowl. Stir well to ensure that it’s fully combined. Adding the vanilla is an optional step. You can omit it if you prefer. Pour the peanut butter mixture over the popcorn. When the peanut butter and chocolate mixture is fully blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn. Stir the mixture with a spatula or wooden spoon to ensure that the popcorn is fully coated. Transfer the popcorn to the bag with the powdered sugar and toss to coat. After the popcorn is covered with the chocolate mixture, add it to the bag with powdered sugar. Seal the bag, and shake the popcorn well to coat it with the sugar. Pour it into a bowl and serve immediately. Store any leftover poppy chow in an airtight container. It should keep for up to 2 days. Whipping Up Pizza Popcorn Preheat the oven and line a baking sheet. Set your oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit (95 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. Next, line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray the paper generously with nonstick cooking spray to grease it. For best results, place your oven rack in the lowest position. Spread the tomato paste on the parchment paper. Open a 6-ounce (170 g) can of tomato paste. Use a small offset spatula or butter knife to spread the paste in a thin layer over the parchment paper on the baking sheet. Bake the tomato paste until it darkens. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven. Let the paste bake until it becomes a deep brick red color and no longer looks shiny, which should take approximately 2 hours. The paste will resemble fruit leather when it’s finished baking. Allow the paste to cool and tear it into pieces. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and allow it to cool until you can handle it comfortably, which should take approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Use clean hands to tear the paste into pieces. You don’t have to worry about ripping the paste into even or neat pieces. Just tear it into pieces that will fit easily in your spice grinder. Grind the paste with the parmesan, oregano, salt, and pepper flakes. Transfer the tomato paste pieces to your spice grinder and grind them down into coarse powder. Next, add 2 tablespoons (10 g) of grated parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, 1 teaspoon (3 g) garlic salt, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of crushed red pepper flakes to the spice grinder. Grind the mixture until it becomes a fine powder. Store the pizza-flavored powder in an airtight container. It should keep for up to a week. You’ll have enough powder for approximately 6 batches of popcorn. Toss the popcorn with the spice. sentences: Preparing Salted Popcorn Caramel Bars Grease a bowl, spatula, and baking dish.
Because the caramel is extremely sticky, you must prepare your tools and supplies.
Use nonstick cooking spray to grease a large bowl, plastic spatula, and a 13-inch by 9-inch (33-cm by 23-cm) baking dish before mixing the popcorn.
If you prefer, you can use softened butter to grease your tools and supplies.
Mix the popcorn and pretzel pieces.
Add 10 cups (80 g) of popped popcorn that’s lightly salted and 40 small pretzel twists that have been broken into pieces to the large, greased bowl.
Toss the ingredients lightly to ensure that they’re completely mixed.
You can air pop your own popcorn or use microwave popcorn.
Just make sure to choose an unbuttered version.
Any type of unflavored pretzels will work for the popcorn bowls.
For example, you might use plain, whole wheat, or honey wheat pretzels depending on your preference.
Melt the butter on the stove.
Add 2 tablespoons (28 g) of unsalted butter to a medium size saucepan.
Heat the butter on medium on your stovetop until it melts completely, which should take 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir the butter to help it melt evenly.
Stir in the caramels, water, salt, and heat until the caramels melt.
Once the butter has melted completely, add 20 caramels, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of water, and ⅛ teaspoon (1 g) of salt to the saucepan.
Allow the mixture to heat for approximately 5 minutes, or until the caramels have melted completely.
Stir the caramel mixture occasionally as it’s melting to ensure that it heats evenly.
Use the greased spatula to keep the caramel from sticking to it.
Add the marshmallows and peanut butter, and heat until they melt.
When the caramels have melted completely, mix 3 cups (150 g) of miniature marshmallows and ¼ cup (65 g) of crunchy peanut butter into the pan.
Allow the mixture to heat for another 1 to 2 minutes or until the marshmallows and peanut also melt.
Be sure to stir the mixture as the peanut butter and marshmallows melt to ensure that all of the ingredients are fully blended.
Pour the caramel mixture over the popcorn and pretzels and toss to coat.
When the caramel mixture is fully melted and blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn and pretzels.
Use the greased spatula to toss the mixture well so the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture.
The caramel mixture may be hot, so be careful not to get any on your skin.
Press the popcorn mixture into the baking dish and cool completely.
Once the popcorn and pretzels are coated with the caramel mixture, use the spatula to transfer it to the greased baking dish.
Press the coated popcorn down, and allow it to cool completely, which should take 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Make sure that the popcorn is in a single, even layer so it’s easier to cut the mixture into bars.
Cut the popcorn mixture into bars.
When the coated popcorn has cooled and set, use a sharp knife to cut it into bars.
You should wind up with approximately 24.
Store any leftover popcorn bars in an airtight container at room temperature.
They should stay fresh for 3 to 5 days.
Mixing Up Poppy Chow Place the popcorn in a large bowl.
For the poppy chow, you’ll need 8 cups (64 g) of plain, popped popcorn.
Pour it into a large bowl, making sure to pick out any unpopped or burnt kernels.
You can prepare the popcorn yourself or use a bag of microwave popcorn as long as it’s not buttered.
Add the powdered sugar to a plastic bag.
To make it easier to coat the popcorn, place 1 ½ cups (188 g) of powdered sugar into a large plastic bag with a zipper.
Set the bag aside until you’re ready to add the popcorn.
Use a gallon (3.7 l) plastic bag or larger to be sure that there’s enough room to add the popcorn later.
Melt the peanut butter and chocolate chips in the microwave.
Add 1 cup (250 g) of peanut butter and ½ cup (90 g) of chocolate chips to medium size microwave-safe bowl.
Heat the mixture in the microwave in 30 second intervals until it is melted completely.
It typically takes between 1 to 2 minutes.
Smooth peanut butter works best for the poppy chow.
You can use whatever type of chocolate chips that you prefer, such as milk, semisweet, or bittersweet.
Make sure to stir the peanut butter and chocolate chips after each 30 second interval so the mixture melts evenly.
Mix the vanilla extract into the peanut butter mixture.
When the peanut butter and chocolate are completely melted, add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) of vanilla extract to the bowl.
Stir well to ensure that it’s fully combined.
Adding the vanilla is an optional step.
You can omit it if you prefer.
Pour the peanut butter mixture over the popcorn.
When the peanut butter and chocolate mixture is fully blended, add it to the bowl with the popcorn.
Stir the mixture with a spatula or wooden spoon to ensure that the popcorn is fully coated.
Transfer the popcorn to the bag with the powdered sugar and toss to coat.
After the popcorn is covered with the chocolate mixture, add it to the bag with powdered sugar.
Seal the bag, and shake the popcorn well to coat it with the sugar.
Pour it into a bowl and serve immediately.
Store any leftover poppy chow in an airtight container.
It should keep for up to 2 days.
Whipping Up Pizza Popcorn Preheat the oven and line a baking sheet.
Set your oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit (95 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.
Next, line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray the paper generously with nonstick cooking spray to grease it.
For best results, place your oven rack in the lowest position.
Spread the tomato paste on the parchment paper.
Open a 6-ounce (170 g) can of tomato paste.
Use a small offset spatula or butter knife to spread the paste in a thin layer over the parchment paper on the baking sheet.
Bake the tomato paste until it darkens.
Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven.
Let the paste bake until it becomes a deep brick red color and no longer looks shiny, which should take approximately 2 hours.
The paste will resemble fruit leather when it’s finished baking.
Allow the paste to cool and tear it into pieces.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and allow it to cool until you can handle it comfortably, which should take approximately 15 to 20 minutes.
Use clean hands to tear the paste into pieces.
You don’t have to worry about ripping the paste into even or neat pieces.
Just tear it into pieces that will fit easily in your spice grinder.
Grind the paste with the parmesan, oregano, salt, and pepper flakes.
Transfer the tomato paste pieces to your spice grinder and grind them down into coarse powder.
Next, add 2 tablespoons (10 g) of grated parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, 1 teaspoon (3 g) garlic salt, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of crushed red pepper flakes to the spice grinder.
Grind the mixture until it becomes a fine powder.
Store the pizza-flavored powder in an airtight container.
It should keep for up to a week.
You’ll have enough powder for approximately 6 batches of popcorn.
Toss the popcorn with the spice.
When you’re ready to make the pizza popcorn, add 3 cups (24 g) of popped popcorn that you’ve drizzled melted butter over to a large bowl.
Sprinkle 2 heaping tablespoons (14 to 16 g) of the pizza-flavored powder over it, and toss the popcorn to coat.
If you don’t want to add butter to your popcorn, spritz it lightly with olive oil so the pizza-flavored powder will stick.
Creating Glazed Popcorn Trail Mix Preheat the oven and grease the baking pans.
Set your oven temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.
Next, grease two 15-inch by 10-inch (38-cm by 25-cm) shallow baking dishes with nonstick cooking spray and set aside.
You can grease the baking dishes with softened butter if you prefer.
Combine the popcorn, peanuts, and dried fruit.
Add 8 cups (64 g) of popped popcorn, 1 cup (125 g) of salted peanuts, and 7 ounces (198 g) of mixed dried fruit bits to a large bowl.
Toss the ingredients to ensure that they’re fully mixed.
Make sure to pick out any unpopped or burnt kernels from the popcorn.
You can substitute your favorite nuts, such as walnuts or cashews, for the peanuts.
You can usually find dried fruit bits with the raisins and dried cranberries at the grocery store.
Mix the honey, water, and lemon juice in a pan and bring to a boil.
Add 1 cup (340 g) of honey, ¼ cup (59 ml) of water, and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice to a medium size saucepan with a heavy bottom.
Heat the mixture on medium high to bring it to a boil, which should take approximately 5 to 7 minutes.
Keep an eye on the honey mixture to ensure that it doesn’t boil over.
Boil the honey mixture for a couple of minutes.
Once the honey mixture comes to a boil, allow it to boil for another 2 minutes.
Stir the mixture constantly to ensure that it doesn’t burn onto the bottom of the pan.
Pour the honey mixture over the popcorn and toss to coat.
While the honey mixture is still hot, add it to the bowl with the popcorn, peanuts, and dried fruit.
Use a wooden spoon or spatula to  toss the ingredients so they’re evenly coated with the honey mixture.
Be careful when tossing the popcorn because the honey mixture will be extremely hot and may burn if it gets on your skin.
Divide the popcorn between the baking dishes and bake in the oven.
Once the popcorn is coated, add an even amount to each prepared baking dish.
Place them in the preheated oven, and allow them to bake for 15 minutes.
Stir the popcorn every 5 minutes while it’s baking to ensure that it’s not sticking to the dishes.
Stir the popcorn and allow it to cool.
Remove the baking dishes from the oven, and stir the popcorn immediately.
Next, allow it to cool completely, which should take approximately 20 to 30 minutes, before eating.
Store the popcorn in an airtight container.
It should stay fresh for up to a week.
